security: This document is classified Top Secret and contains information about a former Cuban Air Force chief denouncing a counter-revolutionary leader. The document is an intelligence report.  Revealing the content could compromise intelligence sources and methods.
summary: An NSA document dated November 29, 1963, reports that former Cuban Air Force Chief Pedro L. Diaz Lanz denounced Manuel Artime as being opposed to the interests of Free Cuba, suggesting he supports International Communism.
summary_one_paragraph: This Top Secret NSA document, dated November 29, 1963, relays information from Hialeah, Florida, where former Cuban Air Force Chief Pedro L. Diaz Lanz communicated to Dr. Donald Reid Cabral in Santo Domingo that Manuel Artime, a prominent Cuban counterrevolutionary leader, is against the interests of Free Cuba and, by implication, supports International Communism. The message, indexed by the FBI, bears the classification marking and is slated for potential release in 2025 under the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act.
title: [Restricted]
